text: is the name of the first Japanese space probe sent to the moon. It was the first lunar probe launched by a country other than the Soviet Union or the United States.NASA, Hiten-Hagoromo mission profile ; retrieved 2012-4-16. The launch was a project of the Institute of Space and Astronautical Science of the University of Tokyo. The satellite was sent toward the moon on January 24, 1990.JAXA, "Catalogue of ISAS Missions" ; retrieved 2012-4-16. On the first lunar approach, Hiten released a small orbiter. This was called The lunar orbiter was named after the feather mantle of Hiten == References == == Other websites == * Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency (JAXA), Hiten (MUSES-C) mission profile Category:Japanese satellites Category:Spacecraft launched in the 1990s
title: Hiten (spacecraft)
